release.name: v2.41.0
release.short_description_html: Enable setting sequence to 0, per #225.

commits.message:
Sequence zero bug (#225)

* chore: upgrade package-lock.json

* fix: sequence of value 0 is falsy bug

* fix: remove undefined values instead of falsey values

* test: add test for sequence 0

pull_request.title: Sequence zero bug
pull_request.body:
## Explanation

Setting the `sequence` property to the number `0` results in a created event that doesn't have `SEQUENCE`.
The reason for this is that the library removes falsey values from the ICS file, and `0` is a falsey value.

This PR addresses the issue by removing `undefined` values instead of falsey values.

## Code changes

- [x] upgrade `package-lock.json` to version 2 (simply by running `npm i`)
- [x] add `SEQUENCE` line if it isn't `undefined` in `src/pipeline/format.js`
- [x] remove `undefined` instead of falsey values in `src/pipeline/build.js`
- [x] add a test making sure a sequence of 0 works

release.name: v2.40.0
release.short_description_html: Add dir to organizer schema, per #214.

pull_request.title: Support sequence as zero
pull_request.body:
This fixes a bug, where one cannot set the `sequence` attribute to zero. 

I had to remove the options filter that removes falsy values to get the zero value through. I believe that to be in line with user expectations (better errors than "silent" bugs) but if you'd rather I leave that be and only allow the zero to pass through for the `sequence` option, I can make that change.

issue.title: Downloading .ics file
issue.body: How would you download a .ics file? Is there a built-in method I can use, or should I use the _buildEvent_ method to return a string, then convert to .ics myself?

issue.title: How to use timezone
issue.body:
How to add the TZID= to the time/date?

Thanks

issue.title: Replace uuid with nanoid to reduce the bundle size
issue.body:
> One the same lines moving away from `uuid` and toward `nanoid` will further reduce bundle size
> 
> _Originally posted by @atomicpages in https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/issues/149#issuecomment-760349672_

---

> > One the same lines moving away from `uuid` and toward `nanoid` will further reduce bundle size
> 
> Please! I was just about to say the same, then saw this comment.
> 
> * https://github.com/ai/nanoid/
> 
> _Originally posted by @0xdevalias in https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/issues/149#issuecomment-844940209_

---

For some visual stats, according to `bundlephobia`, `1.5%` (`~2.46kB`) of this lib's `160.8kB` (min) size comes from `uuid`:

(see https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/issues/149#issuecomment-844932986 + https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/pull/178 for the issue + PR to fix the size issues related to `joi`)

- https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=ics@2.27.0

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/753891/118960756-f4573e00-b9a6-11eb-8afc-92c20ffa5e96.png)

issue.title: Fix for the dir field of the organizer structure

commits.message:
Fix/organizer dir (#221)

* add dir to organizer schema

* bump version. closes #214

issue.title: crypto.randomBytes is not a function
issue.body: I am trying to use the createEvent function, and a TypeError showed up in the console breaking everything. If I comment out this part of the implementation, it goes away. I am using TypeScript.

issue.title: crypto.randomBytes is not a function
issue.body: I am trying to use the createEvent function, and a TypeError showed up in the console breaking everything. If I comment out this part of the implementation, it goes away. I am using TypeScript.

comment.body: Should be resolved by switching from uuid to nano.

issue.title: index.ts missing busyStatus property
issue.body:
Hi, 
It seems that type ics.EventAttributes definition misses busyStatus property in index.d.ts
Can you please check if the error is in index.d.ts or if busyStatus is actually deprecated ? 
Thanks for your help!

issue.title: Support for VTODO
issue.body: Are there plans to support task lists and its objects (VTODO) or is it even already supported and I just don't see it?

comment.body: VTODO isn't currently supported, but I'd love to add support for it.

issue.title: ValidationError if organizer has "dir" attribute
issue.body: The Typescript and Joi schemas don't match - if the organizer of an event has a dir, a ValidationError is thrown.

issue.title: Question VALARM
issue.body: Hi, thanks for a great package! I am wondering about the BEGIN:VALARM tag. I have set an alarm, but Outlook (PC) and iCalendar (Mac) seems to ignore the alarm altogether. Is this a known problem with Outlook / iCalendar ? The format seems to be valid. Are any additional values needed for each client to understand/accept the alert? ``` BEGIN:VCALENDAR VERSION:2.0 CALSCALE:GREGORIAN PRODID:adamgibbons/ics METHOD:PUBLISH X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H BEGIN:VEVENT UID:-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD SUMMARY:Purjolök DTSTAMP:20191026T171500Z DTSTART:20191024T080000Z DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen URL:https://app.myapp.se/r/edit/-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD STATUS:CONFIRMED CATEGORIES:Matlista X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:BUSY BEGIN:VALARM ACTION:DISPLAY DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen TRIGGER:-PT10M END:VALARM DURATION:PT30M END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR ```

Hi, @adamgibbons 
I couldn't find out how to set travel time by using this library.
Could anybody show me how?
Thanks

And this field also is not described on Alarm interface

Result ICS alarm:
```ics
BEGIN:VALARM
ACTION:DISPLAY
REPEAT:1
TRIGGER:-PT1M
END:VALARM
```

ICS validator output (https://icalendar.org/validator.html):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84327038/149493987-b0c23f70-df0e-46f7-8001-908ca6942a81.png)

issue.title: RRULE placed after VALARM section
issue.body:
Hello, I am currently having the following issue : 

When I set a RRULE, it is placed at the very bottom of the VEVENT section, Outlook doesn't process properly the event recurrency.

To have Outlook processing it properly, the RRULE must be placed **before** the VALARM section (this is not documented, I just figured it out)

I create an ics file using these parameters :
```js
const invitation = await createCalendarEvent({
      organizer,
      start,
      end,
      title,
      recurrenceRule: "FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5",
      method: "REQUEST",
      location: "My Test Name",
      categories: ["My Test Name"],
      description: "This is my event description",
    });
```

The file obtained has a misplaced RRULE statement. Well it is actually correctly placed if we consider it should be anywhere inside the VEVENT section BUT it does not work with Outlook. it is at the very end of the VEVENT section, which makes the recipient unable to take RRULE into account.

So basically Outlook will be unable to handle this properly. BTW I tried with gmail/google agenda and it works fine ;-)

Here is the ics file I get :

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:adamgibbons/ics
METHOD:REQUEST
X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:g9Oc0jw7aRV4zXLl9FjXp
SUMMARY:test ics 7
DTSTAMP:20220223T164800Z
DTSTART:20220223T194800Z
DTEND:20220223T204800Z
DESCRIPTION:This is my event description
LOCATION:My Test Name
CATEGORIES:My Test Name
ORGANIZER;CN=John Doe:mailto:john.doe@organization.org
BEGIN:VALARM
ACTION:DISPLAY
TRIGGER:-PT30M
END:VALARM
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5 // ---> this should not be here :-(
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```

Here is what we should get in order to schedule properly the event :

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:adamgibbons/ics
METHOD:REQUEST
X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:g9Oc0jw7aRV4zXLl9FjXp
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5 // ---> this definitely should be here :-)
SUMMARY:test ics 7
DTSTAMP:20220223T164800Z
DTSTART:20220223T194800Z
DTEND:20220223T204800Z
DESCRIPTION:This is my event description
LOCATION:My Test Name
CATEGORIES:My Test Name
ORGANIZER;CN=John Doe:mailto:john.doe@organization.org
BEGIN:VALARM
ACTION:DISPLAY
TRIGGER:-PT30M
END:VALARM
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```

release.name: v2.39.0
release.body: Fix validation and RRULE issues in VALARM (#220). Should resolve Outlook issue. Closes #210 and #205.
release.short_description_html: Fix validation and RRULE issues in VALARM (#220). Should resolve Outlook issue. Closes #210 and #205.

commits.message: Alarm fix for Outlook (#210) and added missing types Alarm (#205) (#220)

pull_request.title: Alarm fix for Outlook (#210) and added missing types Alarm (#205)
pull_request.body:
I owe a lot to this module as it made my last big project at my day job possible. But I was hampered by two issues with simple solutions. I knew I had to fix them.

_By the way, this is my first public contribution via PR on GitHub. My first-time is long overdue. 😅_

First is #210 - where Outlook stops parsing after encountering `BEGIN:VALARM`. Thus, `RRULE:` and `DURATION:` will be ignored.

Here's a video demonstration of this issue. Simply re-ordering some lines fixes Outlook import.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2433505/185986308-e79aa6c6-612e-40b7-9c41-dc7bbfb6505a.mp4

Second is #205 where the type definitions lack three properties for the `Alarm` type. I simply added these in, matching the behavior you find in `setAlarm()`.

I personally only needed `description`, but knew I could add the other two just to make it complete.

---

> > One the same lines moving away from `uuid` and toward `nanoid` will further reduce bundle size
> 
> Please! I was just about to say the same, then saw this comment.
> 
> * https://github.com/ai/nanoid/
> 
> _Originally posted by @0xdevalias in https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/issues/149#issuecomment-844940209_

---

For some visual stats, according to `bundlephobia`, `1.5%` (`~2.46kB`) of this lib's `160.8kB` (min) size comes from `uuid`:

(see https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/issues/149#issuecomment-844932986 + https://github.com/adamgibbons/ics/pull/178 for the issue + PR to fix the size issues related to `joi`)

- https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=ics@2.27.0

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/753891/118960756-f4573e00-b9a6-11eb-8afc-92c20ffa5e96.png)

issue.title: Fix for the dir field of the organizer structure

commits.message:
Fix/organizer dir (#221)

* add dir to organizer schema

* bump version. closes #214

issue.title: crypto.randomBytes is not a function
issue.body: I am trying to use the createEvent function, and a TypeError showed up in the console breaking everything. If I comment out this part of the implementation, it goes away. I am using TypeScript.

issue.title: crypto.randomBytes is not a function
issue.body: I am trying to use the createEvent function, and a TypeError showed up in the console breaking everything. If I comment out this part of the implementation, it goes away. I am using TypeScript.

comment.body: Should be resolved by switching from uuid to nano.

issue.title: index.ts missing busyStatus property
issue.body:
Hi, 
It seems that type ics.EventAttributes definition misses busyStatus property in index.d.ts
Can you please check if the error is in index.d.ts or if busyStatus is actually deprecated ? 
Thanks for your help!

issue.title: Support for VTODO
issue.body: Are there plans to support task lists and its objects (VTODO) or is it even already supported and I just don't see it?

comment.body: VTODO isn't currently supported, but I'd love to add support for it.

issue.title: ValidationError if organizer has "dir" attribute
issue.body: The Typescript and Joi schemas don't match - if the organizer of an event has a dir, a ValidationError is thrown.

issue.title: Question VALARM
issue.body: Hi, thanks for a great package! I am wondering about the BEGIN:VALARM tag. I have set an alarm, but Outlook (PC) and iCalendar (Mac) seems to ignore the alarm altogether. Is this a known problem with Outlook / iCalendar ? The format seems to be valid. Are any additional values needed for each client to understand/accept the alert? ``` BEGIN:VCALENDAR VERSION:2.0 CALSCALE:GREGORIAN PRODID:adamgibbons/ics METHOD:PUBLISH X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H BEGIN:VEVENT UID:-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD SUMMARY:Purjolök DTSTAMP:20191026T171500Z DTSTART:20191024T080000Z DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen URL:https://app.myapp.se/r/edit/-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD STATUS:CONFIRMED CATEGORIES:Matlista X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:BUSY BEGIN:VALARM ACTION:DISPLAY DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen TRIGGER:-PT10M END:VALARM DURATION:PT30M END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR ```

issue.title: Question VALARM
issue.body: Hi, thanks for a great package! I am wondering about the BEGIN:VALARM tag. I have set an alarm, but Outlook (PC) and iCalendar (Mac) seems to ignore the alarm altogether. Is this a known problem with Outlook / iCalendar ? The format seems to be valid. Are any additional values needed for each client to understand/accept the alert? ``` BEGIN:VCALENDAR VERSION:2.0 CALSCALE:GREGORIAN PRODID:adamgibbons/ics METHOD:PUBLISH X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H BEGIN:VEVENT UID:-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD SUMMARY:Purjolök DTSTAMP:20191026T171500Z DTSTART:20191024T080000Z DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen URL:https://app.myapp.se/r/edit/-LovTg9y9HPDCHu8mVnD STATUS:CONFIRMED CATEGORIES:Matlista X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:BUSY BEGIN:VALARM ACTION:DISPLAY DESCRIPTION:En grönsak i lökfamiljen TRIGGER:-PT10M END:VALARM DURATION:PT30M END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR ```

comment.body: Please reopen if not fixed by #220.

I couldn't find out how to set travel time by using this library.
Could anybody show me how?
Thanks

ICS validator output (https://icalendar.org/validator.html):

issue.title: RRULE placed after VALARM section
issue.body:
Hello, I am currently having the following issue : 

When I set a RRULE, it is placed at the very bottom of the VEVENT section, Outlook doesn't process properly the event recurrency.

To have Outlook processing it properly, the RRULE must be placed **before** the VALARM section (this is not documented, I just figured it out)

I create an ics file using these parameters :
```js
const invitation = await createCalendarEvent({
      organizer,
      start,
      end,
      title,
      recurrenceRule: "FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5",
      method: "REQUEST",
      location: "My Test Name",
      categories: ["My Test Name"],
      description: "This is my event description",
    });
```

The file obtained has a misplaced RRULE statement. Well it is actually correctly placed if we consider it should be anywhere inside the VEVENT section BUT it does not work with Outlook. it is at the very end of the VEVENT section, which makes the recipient unable to take RRULE into account.

So basically Outlook will be unable to handle this properly. BTW I tried with gmail/google agenda and it works fine ;-)

Here is the ics file I get :

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:adamgibbons/ics
METHOD:REQUEST
X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:g9Oc0jw7aRV4zXLl9FjXp
SUMMARY:test ics 7
DTSTAMP:20220223T164800Z
DTSTART:20220223T194800Z
DTEND:20220223T204800Z
DESCRIPTION:This is my event description
LOCATION:My Test Name
CATEGORIES:My Test Name
ORGANIZER;CN=John Doe:mailto:john.doe@organization.org
BEGIN:VALARM
ACTION:DISPLAY
TRIGGER:-PT30M
END:VALARM
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5 // ---> this should not be here :-(
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```

Here is what we should get in order to schedule properly the event :

```
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
PRODID:adamgibbons/ics
METHOD:REQUEST
X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1H
BEGIN:VEVENT
UID:g9Oc0jw7aRV4zXLl9FjXp
RRULE:FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=TU;INTERVAL=1;COUNT=5 // ---> this definitely should be here :-)
SUMMARY:test ics 7
DTSTAMP:20220223T164800Z
DTSTART:20220223T194800Z
DTEND:20220223T204800Z
DESCRIPTION:This is my event description
LOCATION:My Test Name
CATEGORIES:My Test Name
ORGANIZER;CN=John Doe:mailto:john.doe@organization.org
BEGIN:VALARM
ACTION:DISPLAY
TRIGGER:-PT30M
END:VALARM
END:VEVENT
END:VCALENDAR
```

release.name: v2.39.0
release.body: Fix validation and RRULE issues in VALARM (#220). Should resolve Outlook issue. Closes #210 and #205.
release.short_description_html: Fix validation and RRULE issues in VALARM (#220). Should resolve Outlook issue. Closes #210 and #205.

commits.message: Alarm fix for Outlook (#210) and added missing types Alarm (#205) (#220)

pull_request.title: Alarm fix for Outlook (#210) and added missing types Alarm (#205)
pull_request.body:
I owe a lot to this module as it made my last big project at my day job possible. But I was hampered by two issues with simple solutions. I knew I had to fix them.

_By the way, this is my first public contribution via PR on GitHub. My first-time is long overdue. 😅_

First is #210 - where Outlook stops parsing after encountering `BEGIN:VALARM`. Thus, `RRULE:` and `DURATION:` will be ignored.

Here's a video demonstration of this issue. Simply re-ordering some lines fixes Outlook import.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2433505/185986308-e79aa6c6-612e-40b7-9c41-dc7bbfb6505a.mp4

Second is #205 where the type definitions lack three properties for the `Alarm` type. I simply added these in, matching the behavior you find in `setAlarm()`.

I personally only needed `description`, but knew I could add the other two just to make it complete.

release.name: v2.38.0
release.body: Add ESM support by correcting ESM package configuration (#216 ).
release.short_description_html: Add ESM support by correcting ESM package configuration (#216 ).
